author: teni
title: Secondary school days 8
body:
The nurse on duty examined Bayo. She appeared worried. She made a call to the doctor's residence. We did not hear what she said to the doctor. And when I asked her what the matter was with my friend, the nurse just said he would be fine even though she did sound assuring.




The doctor arrived in a hurry and attended to Bayo. He opened a file for him and write endlessly on it. I wondered what he was writing. Meanwhile, the nurse had appeared a bottle of drip and had inserted several injections on it. Soon, Bayo was placed under drip and then, an ambulance arrived. The school principal too came with three other senior teachers.

author: teni
title: Secondary school days 7
body:
We went out of the dormitory.we met Peter who had come out to unrinate on the lawn. It was the habit of boys to wake up in the middle of night and come out to Wee on the lawn. "where are the two of you going in this darkness?" he asked.  I was surprised that he would show concern. 



I explained the situation to him. He too was alarmed. He said he would go with us. I could hardly believe it because I did not expect such gesture from him. We both took Bayo to the sickbay. It was until we got to the sickbay that I realized that the time was around 2 am.

author: teni
title: Secondary school days 6
body:
But I lost my best friend. It meant the end of a chapter in my school life and began another on a very sombre note. We were already in senior high school when Bayo took ill.



 Till date, I don't know the nature of the ailment. He woke me up one night complaining of severe headache and when I touched him, he was running temperature. I was alarmed. "What is the matter with you," I asked. 



"I don't know, I am just feeling headache and my mouth is dry," he said. I got up and wore my trousers and shirt. I was panicky because it was the first time this was happening. Bayo had always been a strong boy boy. I told him we should go to the sickbay.

author: teni
title: Secondary school days 5aq
body:
She was furious. "Didn't i tell you I was going to wear them?" She asked. "You've punished us already so why are you seizing the slippers? Or you want to give one pair to your friend who doesn't have slippers too?" Asked defiantly. I was already laughing.

"You are very stupid," she said to him. She threw the slippers at us. "Thank you for your understanding. People should bring their own slippers from home when coming to school," he added.

Senior Mabel was already very angry. She told him that she would deal with him later. She was also embarrased. "She's a slipper thief," Bayo said as we returned to the hostel and I just laughed like a drunk.

title: Secondary school days 3
body:
I was fond of him because he was brilliant and had a very good sense of humour. He made fun of virtually all situations.

There was a particular moment that a teacher had caught us under a tree eating banana after breakfast hour. He was a thin tall teacher who was very quick to whip students for the slightest misdemeanor.

The teacher flogged us and confiscated the bananas. He sent us away to our class. "Don't mind the hungry man," Bayo said as we walked to the class.

author: teni
title: Secondary school days 2
body:
As soon as the teacher returned to the class he was taking his subject, I picked up my pen and drew a line on the middle of the bench, demarcating my space; an unspoken warning that he must not dare go beyond his border.



Peter and I were not friends throughout that term. We hardly spoke and he was always annoying me. Everything he did or said annoyed me. I did not like him. Though we never had another altercation, between us was a cold war, very icy. 



So much so that we pretended neither of us existed. Fortunately, peter kept to his space and mind his business. That was years ago. We went to different classrooms the next year. Bayo and I returned to the same desk in JSS 3. Bayo was my best friend in school.

author: teni
title: Secondary school days 1
body:
That had generated so much noise in the class as other students divided themselves to take sides with either of us. Consequently, the class teacher who was taking his subject in another class was attracted by the noise. The man was a strict teacher who rarely spared his long cane but that day, after hearing what happened, he simply said it was a matter of misunderstanding.



"The two of you must learn to tolerate each other. For this reason, I will put you two to share a desk," the teacher said and Bayo, the class monitor was moved to a seat in the front row whole peter was brought to sit with me. I was very angry and he too was angry and every other person in the class knew we were both angry by that decision.
